data: Delirium (Geriatrics / Adult) (Module)
Patient Care
Weight
once, on admission
qdaily
qweek
Communication Order
Do not perform vital signs after 20:00 unless clinically indicated
Orthostatic Vital Signs
qdaily, for 3 days then reassess
PRN
Monitor Intake and Output
TID with food
Perform Swallowing Screen
T;N
Oral Care
After meals and PRN
Feeding Supervision
Assisted feeding TID with meals
Confusion Assessment Method (CAM) Assessment
T;N
Confusion Assessment Method (CAM) Assessment
q12h
Communication Order
PRN, implement PRISME interventions for delirium.  Refer to SHOP
Morse Fall Risk Assessment
T;N
Sleep Log
For 3 days then reassess
zzBehaviour Log
For 3 days then reassess
Wander Alert Device Application
T;N
Apply Bed Alarm
PRN
Apply Chair Alarm
PRN
Constant Observation
T;N
Communication Order
Perform Environment Management
Insert Peripheral IV Catheter
T;N
Urinary Retention Management
Post-Void Residual
T;N, PRN
q8h
qdaily for 3 day
In and Out Catheterization
If post-void residual is greater than 350 mL, insert In and Out Catheter q8h
If post-void residual is greater than 500 mL, insert In and Out Catheter q8h
Insert Urinary Catheter
T;N, Indwelling
Indwelling, PRN, If post-void residual greater than 350 mL, insert urinary indwelling catheter
Indwelling, PRN, If post-void residual greater than 500 mL, insert indwelling urinary catheter
Indwelling, PRN, If post-void residual greater than 350 mL x 3, insert indwelling urinary catheter
Indwelling, PRN, If post-void residual greater than 500 mL x 3, insert indwelling urinary catheter
Remove Urinary Catheter
T;N
T+1;0800, In AM, in case re-catheterization may be necessary but difficult
Activity
Activity as Tolerated
T;N
Up to Chair
TID, with meals as tolerated if weight bearing
Close Observation
T;N
Routine Toileting
TID and PRN
Up with Assistance
q8h
Maintain Head of Bed
30 degrees or greater
15 degrees or greater
Continuous Infusions
sodium chloride 0.9% (NS) bolus
500 mL, IV, once, administer over: 60 minute, drug form: bag
1,000 mL, IV, once, administer over: 2 hour, drug form: bag
Continuous fluids should only be for 24 hours and reassess in AM
sodium chloride 0.9% (NS) continuous infusion
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
KCL 20 mmol/L-sodium chloride 0.9% continuous infusion
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
dextrose 5%-sodium chloride 0.45% (D5-1/2NS) continuous infusion
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
KCL 20 mmol/L-D5W-NaCL 0.45% continuous infusion
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
Medications
Review and discontinue unnecessary sedating medications
If patient has Parkinson's disease / lewy Body Dementia then order quetiapine or methotrimeprazine
If patient less than 60 years of age
haloperidol PRN range dose
dose range: 0.5 to 2.5 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
